meanings.definition: The quality or state of being odd or strange.
meanings.sent1: The oddity of the situation made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: Her unique dress was an oddity at the party.
meanings.sent3: The oddity of the clown's nose made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The oddity of the old house gave it a mysterious aura.
meanings.sent5: The oddity of the painting captured everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: Something that is strange or unusual.
meanings.sent1: The abandoned building was an oddity in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The strange rock formation was an oddity in the desert.
meanings.sent3: The oddity of the talking parrot amused the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The oddity of the glowing mushrooms in the forest was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The oddity of the antique clock fascinated collectors.

meanings.definition: A strange or peculiar person or thing.
meanings.sent1: The man who always wore mismatched socks was an oddity.
meanings.sent2: The old lady who collected rubber ducks was an oddity in the town.
meanings.sent3: The oddity of the cat that loved swimming surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The oddity of the tree with rainbow-colored leaves was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The oddity of the robot that could feel emotions was groundbreaking.
